column4: I'm numbing it.  How do I remount nfs shares that are already in fstab ?
hold shift during boot to get the grub menu.
criminy...  I was hitting delete and swiping across all the F keys.
thanks.  I booted to another kernel, but still can't see anything.  Everything but my eyes are working though, which is good.  And the kernel was held back anyway (I just found out by ssh-ing in)
you can install the newer kernel if you want.. 'sudo apt-get dist-upgrade' will pull in the kernel.. not that that is a solution but it might help
no, lucid is good, and the kernel isn't the problem
I thought that would bring me up to the next distro
nope, it'll update your current packages to the latest available in the repo for your current distro.. also it'll allow you to install automatically held back packages
yeah the left side of the screen.
What do you mean?  Nothing happens when I mouse over there.
you mean dash or the unity bar?

I think the Unity Bar.  And I found what you were probably talking about in System Settings --> User Interface --> Behavior --> Reveal Spot.  Sending the pointer into the left side doesn't consistently bring the bar out though.
I could just quit hiding it...
'sudo -i' will give you a root prompt. much safer than setting a root password.
I can't believe I never knew that...
